input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

type.description: Read simulator to be used (Currently art, nanosim3, wgsim)

number_of_samples.description: Number of samples to be simulated

gsa.description: Should a gold standard assembly per sample be created?

pooled_gsa.description: Should a gold standard assembly for the pooled samples be created?

anonymization.description: Should the data set be anonymized (and shuffled)?

seed.description: Seed for the random number generators

biom_profile.description: BIOM profile for the from_profile mode (optional)

genome_locations_file.description: Location of the genome_to_id file which stores where the genomes to be simulated are stored

ncbi_taxdump_file.description: NCBI taxdump if a specific date of the taxonomy should be used

metadata_file.description: Location of the metadata file, storing additional information about the genomes such as taxonomy ID

fragment_size_mean.description: Fragment size to be used - only applicable for paired-end short reads (i.e. art read simulation)

fragment_size_sd.description: Fragment size standard deviation - only applicable for paired-end short reads (i.e. art read simulation)

base_profile_name.description: Path (folder) of the profile for read simulation, different for each read simulator

distribution_files.description: Path to a file containing genome ID and abundance if de novo mode with fixed abundances should be run (i.e. without using log-normal distribution)

log_mu.description: Mean of the log-normal distribution (empirical value is 1)

log_sigma.description: SD of the log-normal distribution (empirical value is 2)

gauss_mu.description: Mean of the normal distribution (if used)

gauss_sigma.description: SD of the normal distribution (if used)

verbose.description: Show the used distribution before simulating
